title: Drawing, "Design for a painted ceiling", ca. 1810
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on white laid paper.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, left lower corner: ARMEE DE PRUSSE; right lower corner: ARMEE D'ALLEMAGNE; right lower side: ARMEE D'ITALIE; right upper side: ARMEE DE POLOGNE; right upper corner: ARMEE D'EGYPTE; left upper corner: ARMEE DES ALPES; left upper side: ARMEE DE HOLLANDE; left lower side: ARMEE D'ESPANGNE.
description: In the middle of the center rectangle is a circular medallion with Napoleonic N; the coats of arms of the emperor and of the King of Italy are shown laterally. Laurels are in  each corner of the interior square; depictions of men battling centaurs between the laurels. Outside edge around center rectangle are identical depictions of Victory presenting a figure to a winged male nude. Each scene is separated by armor. The plaques behind each figure refer to specific victories of the Napoeonic army.  The conquered armies are noted on the plaques. The center rectangle and the scenes on the lower left are completed with color.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a painted ceiling", ca. 1810.
ca. 1810. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on white laid paper.. Gift of Eleanor Garnier Hewitt. 1903-12-48.
